mdq:check.name: Dataset Keyword Minimum
mdq:check.description: Check if there are a minimum number of keywords present, and no keywords in title.
mdq:check.code:
def call(): global output global status import re
keywordMinimumCount = 3
# Fail if no keywords present if (not 'keywords' in globals() or keywords is None): output = "No dataset keywords found, unable to check keyword count." status = "FAILURE" return False
# Now check if any of the keywords are in the title. If yes, then the check fails # Note There can be just a single keyword, in which case the quality engine will return # a unicde string instead of an array # Single keyword if(isinstance(keywords, str) or isinstance(keywords, unicode)): keywordCount = 1 else: # Multiple keywords keywordCount = len(keywords)
# If the keyword count is less than the minimum then fail output = "Only {} keywords are present, and {} or more keywords are required".format(keywordCount, keywordMinimumCount); if(keywordCount < keywordMinimumCount): status = "FAILURE" return False else: # Passed all tests! status = "SUCCESS" return True
